website_summaries.verdict: Homeowners who need to do occasional tile work will love this entry-level wet tile saw. Instead of using manual scoring and snapping methods, owners can make accurate cuts with an actual wet tile saw. We suggest upgrading the blade.
pros: Has many of the same guides and guards as higher end models
Easy to assemble and carry to the work site
cons: Quality of original blade is variable – upgrade to diamond blade recommended
Motor speed is slow, cutting projects take time
Difficult to clean out debris after use

website_summaries.verdict: Best for big projects that require a lot of power.
pros: Provides high quality details like stainless steel tabletop and 0- to 45-degree beveled cut capabilities
Blade cooling water reservoir minimizes dust while keeping the blade cool

customer_reviews.title: Great little lapidary cutter
customer_reviews.text: I recently became addicted to rock hounding and I wanted a little saw to cut rocks. PERFECT!! it is light weight, and the blade has cut through everything I have tried with ease. Compared to "official" lapidary cutters, you can't beat the price. Words of wisdom>>>>don't try it out in your kitchen!!! I turned it on for the first time and it washed my walls. Definitely need a plastic apron or a rain suit. I put it in the basement and the mess just goes down the floor drain now. Make sure you keep the water trough filled.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 out of 5 but almost a 4
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for a weekend warrior. If you have 3/4 projects down the road this would be helpful for those. If you are a contractor or trying to flip a house I would buy a high quality or larger saw. I will also say after my first tile project with this I did replace the blade with better quality one. I will say if I was to buy again, I would buy the larger version. I hope this was helpful
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Pay more for the overhead saw, don’t waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: The guide adjusts front and back and is made of flimsy metal, as you tighten one end, the other end bends out of square, the ruler marks cannot be read because the water and debris are sitting on the table top. Your tile and hands are always in the debris field, very poor engineering. The tiles chip when you come to the end, even when taped and going so slow. I spent most of my cuts just cleaning the deck and adjusting the guide bar, made the job twice as long. Finished my job with splinters in my hand and glass chards all over the floor. Don’t waste your money, I will borrow my daughters saw in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy I Miskell

customer_reviews.title: The bed gets sticky with material and I modified mine.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it as a tile saw, but after realizing that the bed surface becomes quickly over run with material from the cutting, I decided to modify it. I made it into a stone shaper with different 100 - 6000 grit diamond wheels for shaping stones. I didn't change the saw to any extent, but added some shields to direct the water back into the reservoir. So far it is working great for my needs. A moving bed is much better for making straight and accurate cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C

customer_reviews.title: Blade guard won’t stay on and mine was already used
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how it worked. I bought it in Jan and remodel took longer than I thought and now 5 months later opened it up and 1) it had been used already and 2) the blade guard wouldn’t even stay on. It was stripped from the beginning. Not my first tile saw but definitely the last of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey M

customer_reviews.title: The little saw that could!
customer_reviews.text: Used this product to cut tiles for my kitchen backsplash. Now I have done a lot of tile work over the years and mistakenly thought that with mosaic tiles I would not need to use a saw (my old one wore out years ago), was I wrong! I ordered this, the "cheap version" looked like junk in the reviews so I spent the extra $20 and am so glad I did. Easy to assemble, easy to clean up, and went through the tiles like a champ! Very happy with my purchase and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Pearce

customer_reviews.title: I agree with most of the reviews here this is a good saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: Meh, I agree with most of the reviews here this is a good saw for the money. HOWEVER If I had to do it again after tiling a shower with 3" x 6" marble tile I would have spent an extra 30 or so to get a saw with a better fence system. This one is a pain, you have to loosen wing nuts on both sides to adjust it and after a few cuts the dust gum really makes it a pain to slide.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!  Could not have tile my kitchen backsplash without it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tile saw to help install a glass tile kitchen backsplash. I absolutely could not have done this job without it! I did purchase a 7" Ridgid glass tile saw blade to use with it. My only complaint is that the table is a little on the small side and the water trough definitely doesn't hold enough water. I was refilling it after every 2-3 cuts. The saw cuts great and I was able to make some pretty thin slices of tile to fit some tight spots! Overall, with the above issues with table size and water capacity noted, I highly recommend this saw to anybody doing small diy type tile jobs.
customer_reviews.author: funfan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem getting this product setup and running. Actually I bought a diamond blade separately because I didn't expect there was one included, but there was. I cut two pavers yesterday in my garage and was surprised how much fine white dust is formed from it. Then I went online and learned that cutting stones can yield a high concentration of silica dust and it's very dangerous to inhale. It would be nice if any product having this risk sold to general consumers had a piece of paper warning on the risk of causing serious lung damages. Use this outdoor and keep the dust flying away from you while you are wearing a mask.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate instructions and faulty parts
customer_reviews.text: Tile cutter did not work because the included parts did not position the blade correctly in order to function. The instructions were entirely inadequate. My father is a retired engineer and technician and assisted me in assembling the device, reviewing the instructions and confirming that the flanges were inappropriate to lining up the blade with the blade aperture. The instructions did not even list the flanges as parts or instruct as to how they fit together -- we had to figure that out ourselves. I guess you get what you pay for, or in this case, you get nothing. The Skil company needs to work on quality control in terms of both products and documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rhinewine

customer_reviews.title: Great little tile saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw and a better blade to complete a glass tile project in my kitchen. It worked great even better than I thought it would! The cuts were very accurate and with limited distortion. If you take your time and don’t rush your cuts, it will perform as expected and advertised. I like that it’s so compact. It holds only small amounts of water but I just used a plant watering can to keep it filled.
customer_reviews.author: Be Happy

customer_reviews.title: WTF!!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually try to rate my reviews based strictly on the product however, I purchased this item and just opened the box to use it and this thing must have been previously returned as there are several marks on the table and some kind of paint or other material on the legs of it. Don't they inspect this stuff before they send it out?!?
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: Don't... Just don't
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap but completely useless. For example, the blade guard is held on with an L bracket that isn't aligned with the blade...so your limited to a 6 inch cut. You could remove the guard but then the blade is slinging dirty water directly into your face... And everywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: New mom to be

customer_reviews.title: BEST LAPIDARY SAW!!!
customer_reviews.text: LAPIDARY SAW!! Took rough crystals to ready to polish in SECONDS! I am so glad I went with this wet tile saw. It cuts and trims with ease. Other lapidary saws sell for over $500-Don’t waste your money. I cut through amethyst, bloodstone, and garnet without even the saw slowing down So happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Vineis

customer_reviews.title: The disc cover does not even fit to the base
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic tile cutter but a very cheep quality one. It supposedly comes with protection over the disc, but the screws that come with it do not even fit to the base. When you cut tiles without that cover it is dangerous. On top of being dangerous, after two tiles, you ruin your clothes and vision. This is an idiotic cutter. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DIYguy

customer_reviews.title: great price, great compact saw
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a wet saw and it was a pleasure. I did not use enclosed blade. I was working with glass tiles and bought a super great and pricey saw blade particularly for that function. I set up in tub cuz of mess in small apartment. I found that free styling worked better for me than using rip fence. I could feed tile easier with the proper amount of pressure. My tile was painted on back and paint side up worked best. I was able to do tidy cuts for my outlets etc. Would highly recommend. Wear rubber panties if doing this squatting in tub!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint with this saw was that the blade was aligned so close to the table metal that it could not get the blade up to speed due to contact/friction. This is not a strong motor, so anything touching the blade on start up will prevent it from spinning. I took a metal file and shaved a 1/16th of metal of the table top and it worked great or as it should when received. I would have exchanged it for another if I would have had more time to wait for another shipment.
customer_reviews.author: AZTony

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, price is right!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to cut glass and aluminum tiles for our kitchen. Cut one or two pieces and you’ll easily have the hang of it. In short order I was making tricky cuts around outlets and window. Doing the grout was way harder! You need to replenish the water reservoir often, cleaner water makes the cutting easier and quicker. If the water gets too dirty you need to slow down when cutting.
customer_reviews.author: JadedMark

customer_reviews.title: Did the job for my backsplash tiles.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to cut my backsplash tiles for kitchen. Worked like a charm and felt it was well worth the cost, less than $100.00. Was my first attempt at installing backsplash and had no problem, this saw made it easier. Get it, you won't be disappointed. See tiles in background of picture included.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to do a tile job in my bathroom. the saw that i had just want doing the job. So i looked into a wetsaw for tile. After reading different reviews I came across this one. Cheaper, with great reviews. It lived up to the hype. Granted it probably isnt as good as the higher priced ones. but it does an excellent job. Clean fast cuts, easy to use without over complication. I would def. recommend this for the average DIY'er. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jay6

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck...just check locally cause it could be cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Despite finding this little guy at Lowes for about $17 cheaper after I bought it here I am still happy with what I have got out of it. I did my first tile job with it on a bathroom I am building and I have to say it was a lot smoother than I anticipated. Fill the reservoir with water to the fill line and you are off to the races. A mist of water spits towards you while its on but to be honest...I was worried about staying clean and if You are, I'd hire someone to do the job for you. Easy to assemble and accurate enough for simple straight cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley White

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the price or the size fool you. You can do a lot with this saw if you are patient and crafty. I've seen some folks make a larger surface area using plywood and some 2x4s. I ended up cutting some 15x15 size tiles on it without any additional support. Mind you, they were at right angles, but still worked well. Because the job was small, I didn't want to purchase anything larger. I just needed to finish out a walk in pantry. Worth every bit of what I paid for it and saved me a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I would certainly recommend the small investment if you think you're going to ...
customer_reviews.text: Four previous tile jobs I always use the slice and crack method. Purchasing the saw made the job much more professional and enjoyable to do. I would certainly recommend the small investment if you think you're going to do more than one job, or if you think that it's critical to have exact Cuts. This was used for my third and fourth tile jobs, and will be certainly used again in the future. If you don't mind free guiding tiles through the saw, it can handle much larger tiles than the description describes. I had no issues making a variety of Street cuts on 8 to 12 inch tiles.
customer_reviews.author: 8621greg

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw for minor tile work. We retiled a tub surround and this was so easy to use that even my wife felt comfortable cutting tiles. Cleanup was a different story. There’s no removable tray to hold the cut tile slurry. As a result getting all that slurry out of the built-in tray is a messy ordeal. Certainly not a dealbreaker since the saw was so reasonably priced, but still something that’s noteworthy to potential buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Economical alternative
customer_reviews.text: I cut small slabs from gemstones. You will need to invent a rock vise that will follow the guide bar. I used a piece of aluminum channel, a couple of small aluminum angle scraps and a C clamp. Goe easy until you can afford a much larger slab saw, but this produces good cuts on small rocks. It is an excellent trim saw. I use a small pump in a five gallon bucket in order to always keep the small water reservoir full.
customer_reviews.author: John Elliott Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last through one small bathroom tile job
customer_reviews.text: Frustrated because I bought this to cut tiles for my bathroom remodel and half way through the job and it just stopped working. Motor runs but the blade doesn't turn. I only used it three times but now it has been over a month and it looks like my option for returning it is gone from Amazon. I have reached out to product help twice now and they keep telling me they will get back to me but then never call me back. Really annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Messy fun!
customer_reviews.text: It was such messy fun using this saw. I bought it to use for some cuts I needed to make to tile my kitchen counter. the saw performed perfectly. It would be best to keep a container of water nearby to add to the water trough as it is small and will need to be watched and refilled frequently. I put the saw on a plastic utility table on my covered porch and it worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Cheridah

customer_reviews.title: Buy this saw, you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first saw and once I got the blade screwed on tight, cutting tiles was easy. I did two good sized projects with one blade but I think I will need to replace it if I do any more tiling. I would recommend to everyone to buy this saw rather than rent. The instruction manual for assembly was easy to read, and the saw easy to use, especially for a novice diy'er.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Schneider

customer_reviews.title: For the money this thing is great. It's not some crazy stellar wet saw but ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money this thing is great. It's not some crazy stellar wet saw but it gets the job done. We did our bathroom with it and didn't have any issues. It's small so you have to put it on a stand. It does use water quick but it really wasn't an issue. We had a pitcher of water next to it and it was fine. Small projects = WORTH IT Big projects = Maybe spend a little more money
customer_reviews.author: Crooked Lamp

customer_reviews.title: Great for home projects
customer_reviews.text: Did a kitchen floor with about 300 sq ft of tile. Tile used was about 33" x 5.5" and 1/4" thick. You'll want to use in a area where you don't mind making a mess. Works best when the water reservoir is kept filled, but the higher the fill, the more spray from the blade, so it did not all return to the reservoir. I put the saw in an oversized cookie baking tray to contain the mess. Did hundreds of cuts, including full length 33" cuts. Needed one additional blade (plus the one it comes with) to complete the work. Very confident that it will work for any other tile projects in our home.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Little Helper.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and simple. Easy to use. Good buy for simple DIY projects than renting multi day. Used it to cut retaining wall bricks had to turn over blocks to fully cut (thicker than capacity) or still use a chisel splitter after making cut on one side. I like Ryobi's model with a sliding tray much better but for the money this is more than workabke.
customer_reviews.author: Rokzi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little tile saw, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the price. I used this for 6" ceramic tile. You can probably do a bit larger, but not much. Options at Home Depot didn't even compare, much more expensive. This thing cut my ceramic tiles perfectly. It felt safe to use, was able to do oddball cuts without issue (T shapes). Cuts look cleaner than the hand cutter for straight cuts. Overall, would buy again, and definitely would recommend. I only did a two wall, maybe 9ft high standing shower with niches (so not a ton of tile), but totally worth it even for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cool little tile saw Pros: 1. low cost, cuts tile adequately. 2. Helped me get through my little household project. Cons - 1. Water sprays out even with the guard set fairly low. 2. The fence is not parallel to the blade and binds when you cut tile. I have to set the furthest end slightly wider than the near end 3. The water reservoir is very small. Kept having to fill it. Perhaps a function of 1 where water sprays out 4. It's too small to effectively cut 12 inch tile. Recommend this if you are on a budget and just performing a smaller job.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo97se

customer_reviews.title: Overachiever
customer_reviews.text: Let's be honest up front. At this price point you know that you are not getting the biggest, most durable, feature-packed saw on the market. But for what it is, it does a great job. I recently completed a bathroom remodel with large tiles on the floor and the shower walls. The tiles were porcelain, and they were thick. Frankly, this saw is not recommended for that kind of work, but it did the job just fine, and is now ready and waiting for my kitchen remodel. Go slow, keep it filled with water, and you'll be pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw instead of renting a saw at the local hardware store. They charged $47 for 4 hours and $67 for full day. I had planned to use the saw over 2 days. It didn't end up taking that long but I now have it to use for future projects. The saw worked flawlessly and I would recommend it to anyone needing it for a small job or even several small jobs. I have a straight tile cutter as well so I only used this for the odd cuts. It cuts very fast. I used it on tiles 16 x 16' without the guide.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Functional and affordable tile saw
customer_reviews.text: I had a bathroom project to complete and needed to cut tile for a backsplash. After researching many other saws, I opted for this one. I was and still am impressed with it's performance. For sure it is not the "go to" saw for a tile pro I would guess, but if you are a do-it-yourself type for the occasional tile job, it performs well. The blade stays adequately wet due to the water reservoir. The reservoir does accumulate waste from the tile, but that is expected. When needed, I rinse it out and fill it with water again. I used it to cut tile that was glued to mesh backing. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bluggy

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great saw
customer_reviews.text: For a basic wet saw the accuracy of cuts is very good. It can have a tendency to want to chip at the end when using the square guide, but it corrected easily by removing.the included blade was a bit dull but that is not really an issue as I always change blades to one of my preference. Setup was easy and this affordable saw is well worth the money. My project was a fairly decent sized porch with cuts that required some precision cuts..
customer_reviews.author: J. Carney

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are amateur DIYers. We purchased this wet saw to redo a 30 sq ft powder bathroom floor. It worked perfectly for our needs. It was pretty easy to use and made very clean cuts. If you're looking to save money on a more expensive wet saw or a wet saw rental and have smaller DIY projects, I'd definitely recommend this product! 10/18/20 update: We used this wetsaw for a much larger bathroom remodel (200 sq ft of floor and shower) that was 100% done with carrera marble. We did buy a special marble blade (not terribly expensive) but this saw was amazing! So impressed what we were able to accomplish with such an affordable saw!
customer_reviews.author: ANeese

customer_reviews.title: Literally useless
customer_reviews.text: I’d like to use I used this once, but that would be far too generous a term of how it functioned. The blade constantly stopped because it couldn’t handle cutting, smelled like something was in fire, and was entirely useless. I don’t plan to resell, just throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Dan

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: The tightening screws for the arm guard stripped after two turns with the screw driver. That was nice. Finally got the thing ready, plugged it in, turned it on and pop. Stopped working and smelled burnt. Awesome. Past the return window but I’ll charge back my credit card.
customer_reviews.author: amyb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for DIY tilers
customer_reviews.text: This saw worked perfectly to cut~25SQFT of glass subway tile back splash. And for $79 that's almost what you will pay to rent one for a full day. Also reduces the stress of having to rush to finish the job to get the rental back to the store. Obviously it's not a very large saw, so the small platform might not work well with large format tiles. The job I just finished was 2x4" subway tiles mesh backed in 12x12" sections and the size was fine. This was third tile job I've done and I regret not having bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Christina DeFrancisco

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Good value. I’ve been renting a tile saw as needed during our house remodel, and a $50/day (yeah-it’s high around here) this was a no brainer. I can see where it’s not the type of product that will hold up for everyday use long term. But it’s light, easy to use and set up, and cut through everything I asked it to. I used this for a project in a 50 sq ft hallway, not so sure that the blade hasn’t already dulled some. But hey, for the money and convenience, I’m all in.
customer_reviews.author: Megan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. This tool was so great for cutting my tiles and even worked on wood with a simple blade exchange. A little bit of edge chipping that might have been avoided with scarring and snapping but I've never done that so I'm only guessing. It was very minimal with this saw. I didn't use the guides because I only had 4" cuts, but I would assume their helpful to get straighter cuts. Easy to use, easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: EA206

customer_reviews.title: Don't rent... Own a tile cutter!
customer_reviews.text: My unit came with a blade, but I bought another blade (highest quality) and I am loving this machine. No hose hook up needed, since it has a water reserve. Since it is a reserve, it needs to be cleaned out (which is simple) fairly often, or else there is a ton of porcelain powder buildup in there. I have been using in freezing conditions, so instead of a problem with the water heating up, I am finding that I need to replace with luke-warm water to prevent the freezing. Nice "problem" to have!
customer_reviews.author: SkilletCranks

customer_reviews.title: occasionally it stalled if I started pushing unaligned- it puts side pressure on the blade and stalled- but once I figured this out and pushed the tile through at the right pace it cut all my tiles no problem and is still working fine with original blade
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut all the border tiles (40pcs) in a big workshop floor. Tiles were 20" square. I setup in the yard, left a hose trickling in the water reservoir and cut the tiles. The tiles were too big to use the table guide but No problem manually pushing the tile through the blade without the guide. occasionally it stalled if I started pushing unaligned- it puts side pressure on the blade and stalled- but once I figured this out and pushed the tile through at the right pace it cut all my tiles no problem and is still working fine with original blade.
customer_reviews.author: MG00001

customer_reviews.title: Too light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a tile saw with a burned out motor. However, this new saw is much too light. Because of its light weight it creeps along the floor while cutting tile, in unpredictable directions. I need to put it on a raised surface and clamp it down for it to work efficiently. Additionally, the water reservoir isn't removable to, in order to dump out the dirty water the entire saw needs to be picked up and dumped.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.  Home DIY.
customer_reviews.text: Very decent little saw. Retiled a whole shower with it. I cut 12” x 24” tiles and a marble threshold. I felt like I got more wet than I should have. Maybe had the guard wrong. Without the guard, you will get soaked. No issues with the diamond blade that comes with it. Easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: DaBlakesta

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU'RE THINKING ABOUT BUYING THIS, DO IT, YOU CANNOT GO WRONG.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this saw. On the drawback side, the reservoir is a little small and requires frequent refilling, and the table surface is a bit small making it challenging to work with large tiles. But those obstacles can be easily overcome. Build a table around it, and keep a hose hanging from the reservoir and they're no longer problems. The positives far outweigh the drawbacks. I cut granite tiles that were 18 x 31 inches, for 15 feet of kitchen counter, the same granite along with 12x24 porcelain tiles for a shower surround and bathroom wall and it's still working just as good today, as it did out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Brentster

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to initially cut a few tiles for a backsplash I was working on. I ended up making over 100 cuts--both straight and a few 45 degree cuts and it worked flawlessly. Because it's a wet saw, it does get a little messy, but cleanup was simple. Now I'm looking for other tile projects because the saw is easy to use and makes quick work of cutting tiles to the proper size.
customer_reviews.author: Matt R.

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, but prepare to be soaked!
customer_reviews.text: I used the saw to cut quartz stone for a fireplace. Overall very easy to use, but the amount of water that sprays you is ridiculous. My clothes were soaked and I couldn't keep my eye protection clean. I did that project in July, now during a cold February I'm planning another project, but there is no way I could use this saw outside with all the water spray. It gets 4 stars for price to function ratio, but I wish I bought the step up model to avoid the spray in the face.
customer_reviews.author: Hise

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Don't think this thing is going to hold up to contract work. Tore out and redid our entire shower, extended the wall and everything. This thing held up great and did just what I needed it to do. I didn't want to spend 400 on a saw to use it once every 5 years. This is now in the shed and will probably sit there for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: I have one mosaic tile back splash project at a lake house. Very hard to find people to show up for one project in this community and I know how to do tile work. So I bought this saw. I'm 75% of the way through the project and the saw has performed very nicely. Much cheaper than hiring someone who may or may not show up and I can work at my pace. I would recommend this saw. The blade that came with it is still working just fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Howitt

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid saw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these smaller saws years ago (about 15 years). I basically used and abused it until most recently it just stopped turning! This saw worked spot on straight out of the box. I had to free-hand cut 18" tiles across the diagonal and... not a problem at all. For the limited number of tile jobs I foresee in my future, this seems like it will do just fine! Solid and smooth!
customer_reviews.author: R. Marracino

customer_reviews.title: GREAT inexpensive wet saw!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently remodeled our kitchen and bought this saw to cut 6" travertine tiles for a back splash. It worked perfectly. We were going to rent a saw but they weren't available to rent, and the price of this saw is minimal, probably not much more than the cost if we could have rented one, and now we have the saw to use for other projects. It comes with a diamond blade that will hold up for many cuts. Make sure you use it outdoors or in a place where a splatter of water won't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good wet saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you are NOT a professional installed and are doing a bath renovation or a floor, this saw will be worth the price. The water reservoir is not very big, so you need to replenish it frequently. And, wet saws inherently accumulate mud in the reservoir from the cutting process, and it should be cleaned almost daily - which is not a big deal - you just need to do it. But it is a good saw for the price - cuts 12' tiles (or bigger with a table extension. And it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd A. Rhoades

customer_reviews.title: Great first timer tile saw!
customer_reviews.text: I just finished my first tile project using this tile saw. The saw was easy to use, and not really intimidating at all. The only issue I had was that at the end of each cut the tile would break off at the very end instead of letting me finish the cut. Since most of my cuts are in inconspicuous places, none of these breaks are visible, but it was a little annoying. I think maybe a better blade would help but I’m not 100% sure. The project turned out great though and I’m very happy that I had no major problems using this tile saw to get it done!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible. Anyone who says this saw is great has never used a real tile saw.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fraczek

customer_reviews.title: ... used it for a small project and it worked fine. We had another larger project come along several ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a small project and it worked fine. We had another larger project come along several months later, which required true and exact cuts. Turns out the cutting wheel is warped (and probably was when I got it but I didn't notice it because I was cutting very small pieces, and no exact cuts). But now I've had too long to return and it's worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Tried to make 2 cuts. The saw vibrates all over the workspace so it was impossible to make a straight cut. The 1st cut was ok but croqued at the end. The second piece of tile broke. While trying to cut both tiles the blade stopped moving a couple times. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first and only tile saw I've used. I used it on a small tile project and it performed better than I expected it to given the very reasonable price tag. I didn't have an opportunity to use the angle cutting feature. After I use it, I will update this review. I would recommend this tile saw for the average DIYer. Pros: Arrived quickly Easy setup Easy operation Straight accurate cuts Cons: Blade guard knob placement should be positioned higher to prevent tile from hitting it. Not really a "con" but a removable water tray would be a nice improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great homeowner saw
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this tool. I was able to "rip" 22'x12" tiles as well as "cross cut" 12"x 4" tiles. The saw works well "free hand" as well as with the fence. Did not have a reason to use the miter attachment. It is adequate for homeowner projects. As others pointed out you need to keep adding water. But I found keeping a 1# coffee can close at hand to top off while I was cutting a lot. I also used an old shower curtain to cover the work area to contain the spray from the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: If you have money get the really good manual clipper cutter style which is cost over $200
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid... this is cheap saw that's allow you to cut from few angle and L shape cut. But it's messy and loud. The cut result some smooth some is not. You really need take your time or the end of the tile will chipped. If you have money get the really good manual clipper cutter style which is cost over $200. You can work in the house, but not with this saw. I bought this because i do DIY project and don't want to spent alot of money to buy tools. It's ok saw.. not perfect but ok.
customer_reviews.author: Peri

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and accurately cut tile and the concrete backer board for tile. I can't get over how easy it is to use and how well it does. I've cut notches out of the tile and so far haven't broken a single one. For the money, I don't think you can buy a better tile saw.
customer_reviews.author: LBY

customer_reviews.title: Good little saw!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this to cut 20 thick tiles, made at least 40 cuts and the blade held up. This saw replaced a previous exact same model that was sent to me--and was missing pieces and the blade had been used. I recommend opening this sooner rather than later in case you paid for a brand new saw but they sent you something else. They replaced it when I called with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: lululotus

customer_reviews.title: I will recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I have installed in my about 400 SF 12"24" Porcelain tiles. I think it's good quality. Price was affordable for me. 1 blade was included.
customer_reviews.author: Kazi ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Needed a saw to cut glass tiles
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with the performance of this. Was a small job and I didn't want to spend a lot on this. The tiles were small (about 1/2 inch cut). Just do it slow and steady and this will get the job done. The fence didn't seem too precise, but was good enough for me. Also, seems to splash some water (not excessive, but you will get wet). I never used one of these before, so I am not sure if that is expected or not.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Skil 3540 Tile Wet Saw a Keeper
customer_reviews.text: This Skil 3540 wet saw was well worth the price. It helped me complete my shower tile job more quickly and without a lot of aggravation. The blade included worked well on ceramic tile and still has life left in it. I would definitely purchase this wet saw again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good brand, decent saw - stuggles with 3"x6" glass subway tiles, even with a glass blade.
customer_reviews.text: Hesitant to recommend at this time due to difficultly in tiling project. Purchased this and a glass blade to do a backsplash with 3"x6" glass subway tiles. Saw/blade combo is resulting in a TON of tile waste due to chipping, breakage, and backing of glass tiles pulling off. Will give a try and see how the supplied blade does, although it looks too gritty and I fear it may do more harm than good for the tiles. However, it cannot be any worse...and wasting a few more tiles is going to happen no matter what. If I were doing mesh back mini slate/stone tiles....this would be incredible. But I'm not convinced this can truly handle glass tiles, yet.
customer_reviews.author: DDG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect wet saw for the DIYers out there. I did an entire wall 160 sqft and this saw was perfect for the job. About to start an outdoor kitchen project and expecting this to be great again.
customer_reviews.author: LGuiriga

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Did a Master bathroom Tie Saw worked great, Comes with a Blade that cuts well for the first 30 cuts then a little more chipping of the tile happens. the push guide is pretty much useless. it did the job. would buy it again for the price, if your doing a bathroom or kitchen it will get the Job done,
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great!
customer_reviews.text: I retiled my bathtub walls and this little saw worked out great! 214 separate cuts to 3" x 12" subway tile over a period of about a month. Cleaned out the reservoir periodically to keep the work area a little neater. I could have rented a saw, but knew I preferred taking my time and making the right cuts along the way. I did build a little T-square jig to handle cuts that were wider than 7 3/4". All in all, it did the job in fine fashion. Next is the joy of grouting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mearman

customer_reviews.title: Great DIY-er tile saw for the price; better than borrowing or renting
customer_reviews.text: For the DIY-er, this is perfect. I remodeled a bathroom (probably cut 200 4x12" wall tiles) and it kept on working like new the whole time. I only do occasional tile projects, and it is great to have this on hand rather than having to borrow or rent one. I also like that it is not too big because it can go in my tool bin easily. Don't hesitate - just buy it and have fun cutting your tile.
customer_reviews.author: Boy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Spring for one with movable table
customer_reviews.text: The guide on the side doesn't stay, so the saw kicked back multiple times, throwing tile back at me. Dangerous. Get one with a movable table instead.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw needing something inexpensive, but that would also give me nice clean even cuts without chipping or cracking my stone tile. It works great and it’s exactly what I was looking for. I used this saw to do the backsplash in my kitchen and couldn’t have been happier with it. It’s small and easy to store without taking up much space, and runs very quiet compared to other larger saws that I have used. The only thing I can think that this saw needs is a drain plug to release the water when you are done using it. But overall I think this saw deserves 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Spent all last summer with this beauty, can do so much with a small size. Cut over 400 pieces and corners. It definitely does make a mess, plan accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert James

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why this has such a high rating. I bought this for a small tile job (6’ by 6’ bathroom). This saw was more of a hassle than a help. This saw throws water everywhere, is a huge hassle to clean, and makes simple cuts more complicated than they need to be. I would recommend forgoing this and spending a little more money on a nicer saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jared W

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this saw works great. I used it to cut 1 1/4 inch pavers which it did very well. You have to monitor the water tray frequently as it sucks the water out pretty quick. I checked it after cutting each paver. The blade supplied didn't last all that long but a replacement blade bought at Home Depot cut over 30 pavers and is still usable. The motor housing and vents are under the casing. I was able to wash off the table with the hose without getting the electrical components wet underneath. The guide is a little clunky and it is somewhat hard to adjust but works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Wayfarin

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the price. I used it to cut 6" X 24" ledge stone for a kitchen backsplash. The size of the stone made it a little bit awkward to use with the smaller tray on the saw, but I knew that going in. For a standard tile the included guide might work well but for the ledge stone it's not real usable. Again, I knew this going in and still not because of the price. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Wessel Family

customer_reviews.title: It works fine
customer_reviews.text: Use for Fused Glass - with a proper blade ($29 for mine) plenty of water and not too much pressure, it cuts just fine. I am able to cut through layers of fused glass with it. Strongly suggest you get a waterproof apron to wear while cutting with this. For $89 I am pleased with what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Web Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for small projects and lightweight stone cutting
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal for a skillsaw table saw. We're starting to build some marble top shevles and build-ups and wanted to learn how to cut stone properly. This is a great way to learn quickly and easily. Can cut sizes up to 12in. Cuts at an angle too. Easy to set up. Works great. Arrived within 1 day.
customer_reviews.author: EST. LEE DISPLAY L D 1902

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better one
customer_reviews.text: It feels very cheap, I would buy a higher priced, better quality one next time, with that said, it did do the job but took a lot of extra work
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like no tomorrow
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this saw for over a year and have just completed my second tile job with it. I tiled my master and guest bathroom. I would guess I have made at least a 100 or more cuts with it. This saw just won't quit, it just cuts like a dream. I had to replace the original blade after about 30 tiles, but that is all I have done to it. Be prepared for some mess and you are going to get a little wet. For the money you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Shop

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my project
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a single flooring project with some of those wood look ceramic tiles. This tool is certainly messy, after a couple hours of doing cuts I looked like I tripped and fell in the mud, but you're making some compromises to get a super cheap tile saw so I'm not too stressed about it. Definitely a better deal for me to get this than to do multiple days of rentals from the hardware store
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Makes tiling easy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for my new toy. This is the only way to cut tile. Forget snapping or nipping and for this price it's not worth renting. I just cut tiles for my bathroom above the tub surround and it was so easy, I plan to do tiled counters in my kitchen. I'm on a roll, looking for other tiling projects - this is too much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Coral K.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Glass backsplash
customer_reviews.text: This is working good for a natural stone or ceramic tile cutting but if you have any mosaic backsplash with glass , this is not a great tool for that job. It does the job, but no matter how slow you go, the tile chirps at the end.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: A very good little saw
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how quiet it was compared to big tile saw. Cut 13 inch and smaller tile with ease. The water reservoir is very small. Almost have to add a cup of water with every new tile to be cut. Very small compact design. I'm happy with my purchase of it for home owner use only. Not realistic for regular continuous jobs. Its cheap but works good for the money
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect, however
customer_reviews.text: The screws that are supposed to hold the blade guard in place do NOT fit the saw . . . they fit the guard but are too small to fit the slots on the saw. The blade guard is off-set from the saw, so you can't make a cut more than 6" long. This is perfect, however, for smaller tile, and if I'd known how easy a tile saw is, I would never have started with a manual cutter. For the price, this is still a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K Watson

customer_reviews.title: Did the job. Worked for my entire house tile jobs. All you need.
customer_reviews.text: Not a high dollar product , but does the job ! Tiled two bathrooms , and the hallway and shower enclosures. Kinda slow and messy , but then when installing tile do you stay clean and dry ? Did the job , and I sold it later for $15 less than I paid for it. Just go slow and keep the water tray full. Clean out often. Worked fine as long as a Moron isn't behind it expecting to go fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: This tile machine was quick and easy to setup. It worked great for my bathroom remodel. I did have to keep refilling the reservoir after 6 to 8 cuts. The most important thing I noticed was to make sure that the machine was set on a flat and level surface. It helps in not having to refill the reservoir that often. The reservoir can fill up with the tile debris so make sure to clean it out really well after you've finished. Setting the blade guard at the same height as the tile will also help with water not spraying everywhere. I found that the adjustable guide was easy to remove and set.
customer_reviews.author: e2dag

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for DIYers
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a DIYer. You wont be sorry. The blade that it comes with is also not shabby. Of course. pros should opt for a more full featured tile saw with guides etc. This little puppy is great for Small Tile jobs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for do it yourselfers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for medium to small projects. Easy to set up, and easy to clean after. Surprisingly strong motor for a little saw. I was able to cut through 24in tile without any problems. The table top is small but free hand cuts were very smooth and straight. Keep the water reservoir full and wear an old shirt because you are going to get a light spray of water as you cut. Also recommend ear protection, the saw is quiet but the cutting process is very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The blade didn't work at all. I had to buy a different blade.
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: It made all the cuts much easier.
customer_reviews.text: Make cutting tile very simple. Cut very accurately. The main trick is to make sure the blade is straight. Is very easy to tighten it and not realize that it's off a little bit. Spin it around and you will see as long as it's not wavering it is straight. If it wavers loosen it and try again. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. will cut 17 1/2 inch floor tiles with ease. Reservoir hard to fill could also do to be bigger and knife fixing screws could do to be a bit stronger. but overall for the price a great buy and will do what the bigger more expensive saws do.
customer_reviews.author: Graeme M Watson

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it works as advertised. I have never used a so called industrial quality wet saw, so I don't have anything to compare it to. I am not sure an industrial quality wet saw would cut any faster this this one, but I soon found out that when cutting tile, I had to just let the saw do the cutting no matter how slow it might be, but patience is needed.
customer_reviews.author: jello

customer_reviews.title: Decent tile saw
customer_reviews.text: I had a full-size tile saw that but the dust awhile back and I did not want to buy a $300 saw to finish a rehab. The guide on this is a bit cheap and hard to use. But for the price and for a small project this is a good little tile saw.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my kitchen backsplash. It did the job but the blade that came with the saw wasn't great for glass tiles. Make sure you wear gloves, long sleeve shirt and goggles to ensure you don't get any glass dust on your body.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts and design flaws . Request Return to seller
customer_reviews.author: Robert Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Better than those manual tile cutter
customer_reviews.text: Great add-on tool for the home DIY. Probably not suited for pros. I recently used this unit to help tile some bathroom walls. Shower water was splashing and ruining the drywall around the shower tub. The setup was straight forward. The diamond blade provided performed flawlessly in cutting standard shower ceramic tiles. No splinting or breakage even when I attempted to cut small pieces. Adjusting the rail fence can be a chore as well as getting it to line up leveled. After some usage it can be difficult to see the markings. But the $80 I can't fault this unit. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jimbone

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective, accurate and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a wet saw and therefore there was a learning curve but it was easy to use. I cut and installed splitface natural stone tile. It does shoot the water out initially so I would advise using an apron. Over all it did an excellent job of cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L. Yakelis

product_meta.title: SKIL 3540-02 7-Inch Wet Tile Saw
product_meta.description:
Style:Wet Tile SawSkil 3540-02 7" Wet Tile Saw Complete tiling projects easily with the model 3540, 7 in. Wet Tile Saw. The stainless steel top resists corrosion and the adjustable rip fence with miter gauge ensures accurate straight and miter cuts. Skil 3540-02 7" Wet Tile Saw Features: Stainless Steel Table top is Resistant to Corrosion Adjustable Rip Fence with Miter Gauge for Accurate Straight and Miter Cuts 0-45 Degree Bevel for a Wide Range of Cuts Blade Cooling Water Reservoir to Keep Blade Cool and Minimize Dust and Debris 7" Diamond Blade for Fast and Smooth Cutting Skil 3540-02 7" Wet Tile Saw Specifications: Amperage: 4. 2 Arbor Size: 5/8" Bevel Angle Range: 0-45 degrees Bevel Stops: 0 Degrees, 45 Degrees Blade Diameter: 7" Depth of Cut at 45 Deg. : 1" Depth of Cut at 90 Deg. : 1-3/8" Length: 14" Name: 3540 (S12) No Load RPM: 3600 Voltage: 120V AC Only Weight (lbs. ): 18 Width: 13. 25"

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Skil Benchtop Power Tools are Quality Tools at a Great Price !
feature_bullets: Corrosive resistant stainless steel top supports tiles up to 12 x 12-inch
Adjustable rip fence with miter gauge for accurate straight and miter cuts
Blade cooling water reservoir to keep blade cool while minimizing dust and debris
Bevel cuts tile from 0 to 45 degrees. Cut Material: Stone/Masonry
Cross Cut Capacity: 7.75-inch Diagonal Cut Capacity: 7.25-inch

specifications.Warranty Description: 30 Day Money Back Guarantee - 1 year warranty
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,910 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
